Recent updates View all (4)

August 16

Mac OSX Support!

Hey there, all! I recently updated Scribble Space to allow for OSX gamers to enjoy all of the scribbly wonder as well!

To stay up to date on these neat updates, check out my twitter. https://twitter.com/cotycrg

0 comments Read more

July 30

Small Update!

Hey everyone. Two things today:

1. I fixed a bug with some systems not allowing controller input. Thank you to the user who messaged me, bringing my attention to the problem. Feel free to message me if you guys find anything else wrong!
2. My second game has just been Greenlit on Steam! Thank you everyone who voted for Forgotten Lore. It will be going up as Early Access soon - once I get Steam more heavily integrated into it.

0 comments Read more

About This Game

DRAW YOUR SHIP - FLY IT.

Scribble Space is a game about creativity. Scribble Space is a little game where you can draw your own ship and then fly around the galaxy in search of the great Queen Space Bee! You'll travel various terrains and fight numerous UFO tyrants in this fun, action-packed arade-styled shooter!

Like my stuff? Follow me on Twitter. @cotycrg
READ MORE

System Requirements

Windows
Mac OS X
SteamOS + Linux
    Minimum:
    • OS: Windows 7, 8, or 10
    • Processor: the metal part of a toaster when its being heated
    • Memory: 2 GB RAM
    • Graphics: the thing that heats the metal part of the toaster
    • DirectX: Version 9.0
    • Hard Drive: 150 MB available space
    • Sound Card: something that makes noise
    Recommended:
    • OS: Windows 7, 8, or 10
    • Processor: Post 2010 CPU
    • Memory: 4 GB RAM
    • Graphics: DirectX 9 compatible card - anything post 2010 is probably fine
    • DirectX: Version 9.0
    • Hard Drive: 150 MB available space
    • Sound Card: something that makes pretty noises
    Minimum:
    • OS: Mac OSX Yosemite
    • Processor: the metal part of a toaster when its being heated
    • Graphics: the thing that heats the metal part of the toaster
    • Hard Drive: 150 MB available space
    • Sound Card: something that makes noise
    Recommended:
    • OS: Mac OSX Yosemite
    • Processor: Post 2010 CPU
    • Graphics: Something that does OpenGL
    • Hard Drive: 150 MB available space
    • Sound Card: something that makes pretty noises
    Minimum:
    • OS: Ubuntu/SteamOS
    • Processor: the metal part of a toaster when its being heated
    • Memory: 2 GB RAM
    • Graphics: the thing that heats the metal part of the toaster
    • Sound Card: something that makes noise
    Recommended:
    • OS: Ubuntu/SteamOS
    • Processor: Post 2010 CPU
    • Graphics: something that can do openGL - post 2010 preferred
    • Sound Card: something that makes pretty noises

bigh
1,488 products in account
151 reviews
Recommended
3.6 hrs on record
Posted: September 10
Nice little retro arcade shooter game, quite challenging.
Fight in a sidescroller hordes of bees, crabs and some weird turrets. One Boss awaits you at the end of each of 3 levels. Very unique is the scribble design and the good soundtrack. You can even draw your own ship and use it in-game. Just to earn the 20M record seems almost impossible.
Read More

ガム (Gum)
165 products in account
11 reviews
Recommended
0.2 hrs on record
Posted: June 11
This game is adorable.

Pros

- Animations, looks like they were drawn frame for frame with pencil
- Music is pretty unique I wonder what this dev made it on
- boss concepts are hilarious, but difficult like a vertical bullet hell

Cons

- You get hit once you lose buffs
- level 2 is nearly impossible to keep your buffs maintained (makes the 2nd level boss hard)

Suggestions for Dev: Change the hit once lose buffs at least allow people to redeem themselves after being hit once.

Posted: June 1
Hey Coty, Elliot Rodger here.

Just wanted to say that this game is pretty cool, but you should really help casuals like me understand the draw-your-own-ship menu. I don't really get what the frames are for and how to place turrents on my drawing.

Also you've made a typo in the About This Game paragraph on the Store Page.

"action-packed arade-styled shooter!"

Alright, see ya around Coty. Stay cool.

Elliot Rodger here, signing off.

Fun little timewaster. It has a cool aesthetic and the ship customization is pretty novel. Some bugs but nothing game breaking. Collision detection is really wonky, needs a lot of work.
